So far, ours is still ok. However, everything around Lake Almanor has burned, including two of our favorite little towns so far.
The house is decorated with a wonderful collection of interesting pieces of furniture and has all the amenities you need to be comfortable. It’s in a quiet neighborhood with really nice neighbors on both sides. All you need is your clothes and your toothbrush, because Mindy has taken care of every detail. Just in case you forget something, it’s not a problem because you’re conveniently located near grocery stores, drugstores, restaurants, and fast food places, as well as gas stations. review_text: This home was the perfect winter escape during the onslaught of atmospheric rivers in California. If you’re looking for a secret place to stay connected while hoping to explore Lassen County (yes even in winter), then look no further. Not only did the amenities here provide Wifi, a comfortable rest, and ideal privacy, but the home also happens to be right next to the lake and the famous Lassen County. If you haven’t seen the snow capped mountains located five minutes away, you’d be depriving yourself of the hidden gems of California - some things are almost sacrilege to share! One of the unique places about this AirBnB is the rear loading lane. Arriving late at night in the dead of winter, there is no better amenity than unloading your gear that leads you nearly into the home, ensuring convenience and comfort at the same time. We’re absolutely returning as a winter home base!

Guest quarters spacious and comfortable. Unreal Sierra campsite-like location with amenities. A great low-key, 4-acre, fenced Sierra pine filled property with a legit playground for children during the day and, for seniors (or younger adults without kids) like us, a great wake-up perimeter (rooster accompanied!) walk or jog. Ian and Natalie are vibrant and friendly hosts. We'll be lifetime return visitors.
As a side note, we were there during the Dixie Fire, and super appreciated the calm of Susanville, Janesville and the Rio Dosa neighborhood (especially our hosts!) in the midst of a very troubling (and smokey!) situation. We understand that the day of our departure some tireless Cal Fire firefighters used Ian and Natalie's airbnb, for at least one night, before the general Janesville evacuation. God bless them all! Thankfully, from afar on the internet, we could follow the day by day drama of the Dixie Fire and Janesville situation. It seems that after a close call, favorable winds and valiant fire fighting, much of Janesville (and Ian and Natalie and kids!) are now back, safe and sound.
We hope to see them all in the future as they carry on in this beautiful location.
